reviews.review_msg: This is my second time taking a course with Margaret and I am just as impressed as the first time around. She is very nice and easygoing, and you can tell that she cares about what she is talking about. Tests are very fair and lab assignments are very easy. This course can be dry at times but its definitely an easy A if you put the effort in!
She is very monotone. It was very hard to pay attention in her lectures. Study her lecture slides and you should do fine. Labs were a little unorganized but fair and very easy.

Textbook is not mandatory but it can often be useful when doing lab assignments (not buying it isnt gonna hurt your grade). Fair course, fair exams. Found the material quite interesting. Not a bad prof at all. Labs can get quite messy tho 8)

Lab exam was kinda tough - know all formulas because she wont give you all of them, also make sure you know how to do the hand texture method. She threw a couple of curve ball questions I wasn't at all expecting, so just read the textbook to make sure you understand the broad concepts along with the topics in lecture and you'll do fine.

She's rather awkward and has a hard time getting the class engaged but if you attend her lectures, read the notes, and get some extra content from the textbook you'll ace the exams. Skipping lecture & reading webCT notes = you should pass but won't do that well. Lab exam is difficult (memorize things from each lab as they'll show up in the exam).

Very helpful and willing to answer any questions.  I found reading the selected chapters in the text book most helpful after the actual lecture.  The labs and lab exam are alot tougher then the class material.  But overall, an excellent course!
easy exams, but study hard for the lab exam.  know the hydrometer method for the lab exam.  I lost marks on this question.
Very approachable, very friendly. Tests include some thinking questions, but all of the questions are reasonable.  Don't forget to study hard for the lab exam!
beware the lab exam (other exams easy..), she likes earthworms
He's nice enought but I find I have to concentrate to understand his acccent sometimes (especially when he's using jargon or terms)
